Cryptography used to create this signatu: Cryptography used to create this signature. It is auto-detected on valid signatures.
Detection on the input string to determi: Detection on the input string to determine if it is hex or non-hex.
The account that signed the input: The account that signed the input
The account's password specified at the: The account's password specified at the creation of this account.
The blake2b 256-bit hash of the actual i: The blake2b 256-bit hash of the actual input data.
The data that was signed. This is used i: The data that was signed. This is used in combination with the signature for the verification. It can either be hex or a string.
The input data to hash. This can be eith: The input data to hash. This can be either specified as a hex value (0x-prefix) or as a string.
The input data to sign. This can be eith: The input data to sign. This can be either specified as a hex value (0x-prefix) or as a string.
The resulting signature of the input dat: The resulting signature of the input data, as done with the crypto algorithm from the account. (This could be non-deterministic for some types such as sr25519).
The selected account to be unlocked.
The signature as by the account being ch: The signature as by the account being checked, supplied as a hex-formatted string.
This account that will perform the messa: This account that will perform the message signing.
This external account cannot be used to: This external account cannot be used to sign data. Only Limited support is currently available for signing from any non-internal accounts.
This injected account cannot be used to: This injected account cannot be used to sign data since the extension does not support raw signing.
Unlock the account for signing. Once act: Unlock the account for signing. Once active the signature will be generated based on the content provided.
You need to unlock this account to be ab: You need to unlock this account to be able to sign data.
select the account you wish to sign data: select the account you wish to sign data with
